triples.name: Network science
triples.relevance: Network science is the foundational field that this review paper builds upon and extends to higher-order interactions.

triples.name: Complex system
triples.relevance: Complex systems provide the motivation and context for studying network dynamics as a way to understand emergent behaviors.

triples.name: Simplicial complex
triples.relevance: Simplicial complexes are a key mathematical structure used to model higher-order networks where links can connect more than two nodes.

triples.name: Synchronization
triples.relevance: Synchronization phenomena are one of the major dynamical processes reviewed on higher-order networks.

triples.name: Complex contagion
triples.relevance: Contagion processes are a key dynamical phenomenon reviewed in the paper for how information and behaviors spread on higher-order networks.

triples.name: Co-operation (evolution)
triples.relevance: The evolution of cooperation is one of the main dynamical processes studied on higher-order networks discussed in the review.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: Consensus formation is a key dynamical process reviewed, showing how agents on networks can reach agreement through local interactions.
